snippet: The reward for the capture of the militant leader Hafiz Saeed, who is accused of orchestrating the 2008 Mumbai attacks, was likely to further strain relations with Pakistan.
abstract: United States offers a $10 million reward for information leading to the capture of Hafiz Saeed, a Pakistani militant leader accused of orchestrating the 2008 Mumbai attacks; he has emerged at the vanguard of a prominent anti-American lobbying group; reward is likely to further strain US relations with Pakistan.

byline.contributor: Waqar Gilani contributed reporting from Lahore, Pakistan, and Jim Yardley from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: The reward for the capture of the militant leader Hafiz Saeed, who is accused of orchestrating the 2008 Mumbai attacks, was likely to further strain relations with Pakistan.

headline.seo: U.S. Posts $10 Million Reward for Pakistani Militant
headline.main: U.S. Offers $10 Million Reward for Pakistani Militant Tied to Mumbai Attacks
headline.print_headline: U.S. Offers $10 Million Reward for Pakistani Militant Tied to Mumbai Attacks
